name: Timothy J. H. Hele
tagline: Theoretical Chemistry Research Fellow at Cambridge University
body:
I research the motion of particles affected by quantum mechanics and how physical properties such as reaction rates can be calculated for them.

### Biography ###
* 2007-2011 MChem Chemistry (first class) at [Exeter College](www.exeter.ox.ac.uk), [University of Oxford](www.ox.ac.uk).
* 2011-2014 PhD \(Theoretical Chemistry\) at [Trinity College](www.trin.cam.ac.uk), [University of Cambridge](www.cam.ac.uk), supervised by [Prof. Stuart Althorpe](http://www.ch.cam.ac.uk/person/sca10). Together we derived [Quantum Transition-State Theory](http://arxiv.org/abs/1408.0996), which had been claimed not to exist since 1939.
* 2014-2017 Research Fellowship, [Jesus College](www.jesus.cam.ac.uk), University of Cambridge.

### Links ###
* For more general information including past employment, please view my [linkedin profile](https://uk.linkedin.com/in/timhele).
* A detailed list of academic publications is available on [google scholar](http://scholar.google.co.uk/citations?user=DH0CmqMAAAAJ&hl=en).
* [Jesus College webpage](http://www.jesus.cam.ac.uk/?fellow=hele-timothy)
* [Cambridge Chemistry department webpage](http://www-stuart.ch.cam.ac.uk/tjhh.htm)

### Contact ###
tjhh2 {at} cam.ac.uk
